intro: Lass argentina, commonly known as the Argentine lass, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Lass argentina is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
